intro: Jejewoodia, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, the Middle East, and South Asia, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are typically bipinnate, meaning they are divided into two sets of smaller leaves, giving the plant a feathery appearance. Jejewoodia species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where they adapt well to dry conditions. These plants are sometimes used in traditional medicine and can also serve as ornamental plants due to their unique foliage.
